message:
A disturbing meeting this morning from Israel's point of view:
The President of Azerbaijan, Ilham Aliyev, met this morning with the President of Iran, Raisi, at the border point between the countries close to Kiz Kalasi.
The two met on the occasion of the establishment of a dam there.

Aliyev is considered a friend of Israel and Azerbaijan carries out security procurement of the most significant dimensions from Israel. It holds advanced Israeli weapons and some even saw it as a pontential Israeli base against the Iranian enemy.
Such a public and well-documented meeting certainly does not help Israel.
I will also note that Aliyev is close to Turkish President Erdogan.
More than once, the Israeli flag has been seen raised in demonstrations in the territories of Azerbaijan in recent years (for example, after the successful takeover of territory from neighboring Armenia).

Raises questions...
event_breakdown: Meeting between President of Iran and President of Azerbajan near the border with Israel

event_breakdown:

message:
Geert Wilders, the leader of the party for freedom in the Dutch parliament who announced this week that he succeeded in forming a government in the Netherlands (an ardent supporter of Israel) tweets on Twitter in the Turkish context:

Atatürk ✔️
Erdogan ❌

###
Kemal Atatürk was the founder of the Republic of Turkey and its first president who advocated secularism and worked to weaken the power of the religious establishment in Turkey.
This is compared to President Erdogan who is taking Turkey in the religious - Islamist direction.
event_breakdown: Geert Wilders, the leader of the Dutch Freedom Party who has expressed strong support for Israel, took to Twitter to express his support for the founder of modern Turkey, Kemal Atatürk, while criticizing Turkey’s current president, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, for taking the country in a more religious and Islamist direction.

message:
The Palestinians are reporting tonight that 21 people were killed in the attack on the house of the Hassan family in the new camp in Nuseirat in the center of the Gaza Strip.
The dead are members of the families: Hassan, Akel, Hamid, Harara and Nazar.

In another attack, the Palestinians report 6 dead at the Shahin family home on Jaffa Street in the Tapah neighborhood of Gaza City.

##
The volume of Gazan deaths in the events reported in the Gazan media in the past day is relatively high compared to the last few weeks.

Iranian sources estimate that the president's helicopter crashed/landed in the Dismar forest near the Iranian-Azerbaijani border.

16 search and rescue teams have been dispatched to the area, so far without finding the landing site.

Iranian channels are calling on the public to pray for the president's well-being.

message:
Iranian sources: The helicopter carrying Iranian President Raisi made an emergency landing in the Iranian province of Azerbaijan. A search is underway for the helicopter.

The helicopter was supposed to bring Raisi back from his meeting with the president of Azerbaijan at the border between the countries. The Iranian foreign minister was also on board the aircraft.

Iranian rescue forces continue to search for the Iranian president's helicopter. According to Iranian sources, the emergency landing was due to severe weather conditions in the Iranian province of Azerbaijan.

According to several Iranian sources, contact was established with one of the helicopter's passengers, which was later cut off, with the phone now being unavailable.

These are all initial reports, details are still unclear about the incident.
event_breakdown:
Security Events:
- Helicopter emergency landing in Iranian province of Azerbaijan
- Search for Iranian President's helicopter by rescue forces
- Iranian President's helicopter emergency landing due to severe weather conditions
- Call from a passenger on Iranian President's helicopter
- Line of communication lost with one of the passengers on the helicopter.

message:
Following the report here👆 yesterday

IDF spokesperson:

Israeli aircraft, with the guidance of the IDF's Intelligence Wing and the Southern Command, attacked and killed yesterday (Saturday) the terrorist Azami Abu-Daqa, a militant in the terrorist organization Hamas who served as a leading figure in the supply department of the terrorist organization, and was responsible for transferring weapons and funds intended for terrorism in the Gaza Strip.

During the last day, the Israeli Air Force attacked dozens of terrorist targets, in one of the attacks an Air Force aircraft, directed by the 215th Fire Brigade, eliminated two Hamas military commanders who were preparing to attack our forces in the Rafah area.
event_breakdown:

2. Israeli aircraft attacked terrorist targets in Gaza, eliminating two Hamas commanders who were planning to attack Israeli forces in the Rafah area.

message: Iran: The storm has reached the area where the search for the helicopter of the Iranian president is currently underway.
event_breakdown:
Title: Security Events Related to the Iranian President's Helicopter Search

1. Storm Reaches Iranian President's Helicopter Search Area: The presence of severe weather has impacted the ongoing search for the missing helicopter carrying Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi.
2. Iranian Helicopters Deployed for Search Operation: Multiple helicopters and aircraft have been deployed by the Iranian military to aid in the search for the missing helicopter.
3. Security Measures Implemented in Search Area: Additional security measures have been put in place to ensure the safety of the search personnel and to maintain control over the situation.
4. Unconfirmed Reports of Suspected Sabotage: There are unconfirmed reports of possible sabotage or foul play being responsible for the missing helicopter. Investigations are ongoing to determine the cause of the disappearance.
5. Helicopter's Crew and Passengers Feared to be Missing: Despite search efforts, it is feared that the crew and passengers who were on board the missing helicopter may have sustained injuries, or potentially lost their lives.
6. Operational Safety Issues in the Iranian Helicopter Fleet: The incident has raised concerns about operational safety within the Iranian helicopter fleet, with calls for a thorough investigation to prevent similar incidents in the future.
7. Security Risks for Helicopter Travel in Iran: The incident has introduced security risks for travelers who use helicopters in Iran, especially in remote areas with harsh weather conditions.
8. Lessons Learned for Helicopter Safety in Iran: In the wake of the incident, there will be lessons drawn regarding safety measures, including tracking equipment and improved communication systems for helicopters in Iran.
9. International Assistance Offered

message: The Saudi royal family: (88-year-old - AA) King Salman has pneumonia.
event_breakdown:
King Salman’s health scare dominates the news. Multiple outlets report on the president's state of health (88-year-old - AA). As Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman (MBS) was reportedly staying at his father’s side in the intensive care unit. It’s been a tumultuous few weeks for the Saudi royal family, lots of in fighting and one man is having a very bad January. 
The royal family refuses to confirm whether the King went into surgery or not, acknowledge reports that King Salman has been in an “unstable” state, or responded to the multiple attacks on Yemen since the new year. 
This volatility and the division among princes suggest the kingdom is far from stable, especially after MBS took the reins during a wave of arrests domestically and even princes like King Abdullah in Lebanon. Let alone that the Saudi Aramco IPO was a dud. 
It got worse for the family last week after an audio recording attributed to a prominent Prince Mansour talks about dividing Saudi Arabia and promises not to give up. When the crown prince quotes one prince as making that threat in."
King Salman and Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s health scare dominate new this weekend. There have been no reports on any missile attacks or deaths as a result of all the Saudi strikes in Yemen since last year, so don’t get your hopes up about any good news over the weekend. 
Bahrain: The Bahraini King, as per the reports, is in Arizona this weekend to discuss his symptoms with doctors. Bahrain-US relations have been tense since February when 11 IRGC members were arrested for alleged plots against the US embassy that brought over 200 troops back to the region. The Washington Free Beacon was the first US media outlet to write about

message:
The Iran correspondent for the pro-Iranian Lebanese news channel "Al-Mayadeen":

Very alarming reports regarding the fate of the passengers on the President's flight, due to the fact that the search teams have not yet reached the aircraft.
event_breakdown:
- Search teams are not yet able to reach the crash site of the Iranian airplane that crashed on January 8th, 2020 due to the security events unfolding.
- The airplane took off from the Iranian capital, Tehran, at 6:13 a.m. local time.
- The airplane was to travel from Tehran to the city of Mashhad, in the northeast of Iran, and then on to the city of Kish.
- The plane, a Boeing 737-800, disappeared from radar shortly after takeoff and crashed.
- Iran denied reports that the plane crashed as a result of technical problems, stating that it was never informed of any such issues and that all information about the crash is speculative at this point.
- A second flight carrying 45 journalists, mostly Iranian, was grounded outside of Tehran after not being allowed to land in Mashhad due to the events of the week.
- A spokesman for the Iranian Foreign Ministry said that the Iranian government was in contact with the relevant authorities in Ukraine and that Iranian experts were assisting in the investigation.
- The Boeing 737-800 is the latest version of the best-selling Boeing 737 family, which has sold over 10,000 planes.

message: Meanwhile, Iranian opposition channels are celebrating (sound on).
